Class MathUtil

  • java.lang.Object

extends Object
    Small package containing math utilities used by the SmallestEnclosingCircleCalculator class

    Author:
    Frans Lelieveld and Joris Kinable

    • Method Detail

      • sqrt

        public static BigDecimal sqrt(BigDecimal squarD,
                              MathContext rootMC)
        Returns the correctly rounded square root of a positive BigDecimal. Source (publicly available): http://iteror.org/big/Retro/blog/sec/archive20070915_295396.html NOTE: this method is written by Frans Lelieveld, 28 September 2007. Permission has been granted by Frans Lelieveld to use this method in jORLib. The algorithm for taking the square root of a BigDecimal is most critical for the speed of your application. This method performs the fast Square Root by Coupled Newton Iteration algorithm by Timm Ahrendt, from the book "Pi, unleashed" by JÃ¶rg Arndt in a neat loop.
        Parameters:
        squarD - number to get the root from (called "d" in the book)
        rootMC - precision and rounding mode (for the last root "x")
        Returns:
        the root of the argument number
        Throws:
        ArithmeticException - if the argument number is negative
        IllegalArgumentException - if rootMC has precision 0

      • equals

        public static boolean equals(BigDecimal b1,

                             double precision)
        Test whether 2 decimals are equal, given a certain precision

        Returns:

        Returns:
